the short answer is, depends on the kind. Many use x-rays to look inside/thru the body. Some use ultrasound (sound waves we can't hear) to look inside, break up small kidney stones or gallstones. Thermal imaging uses special cameras to show the temperatures of different parts of the body. Bone scans are doing by injecting a slightly radioactive chemical into the body, then taking a full-body picture with large slow camera that records where concentrations are. And those are just the ones off the top of my head. Medical imaging is a hugely growing (and to me, fascinating) field. Most of all, it helps us make sick people better.
